definitions: flat bone in the center of the chest connecting ribs together
examples: The doctor examined the patient's sternum during the chest X-ray
He felt pain in his sternum after the car accident

definitions: chemical substance that includes hormones and anti-inflammatory medications used in medicine
examples: The athlete was banned for using illegal steroids
The doctor prescribed steroids to reduce the inflammation

definitions: medical instrument for listening to sounds inside the body, especially heartbeat and breathing
examples: The nurse placed the stethoscope on the patient's chest
Every doctor carries a stethoscope in their medical bag

definitions: thick soup made by cooking meat and vegetables slowly in liquid
examples: She made a hearty beef stew for the cold evening
The stew simmered on the stove for several hours

definitions: person who manages property or affairs for someone else
person who serves passengers on an aircraft or ship
examples: The estate steward managed the property while the owner traveled
He worked as a steward overseeing the conservation project
The flight steward demonstrated the safety procedures before takeoff
She asked the steward for a blanket during the flight

definitions: careful and responsible management of something entrusted to one's care, especially resources or property
examples: Environmental stewardship is crucial for protecting our planet's future
His stewardship of the company led to increased profits

definitions: small piece of paper or plastic with adhesive backing for decoration or information
examples: The child covered her notebook with colorful stickers
The price sticker showed the item was on sale

definitions: process of making something rigid or the material used to make fabric firm
examples: The stiffening in the collar kept the shirt looking crisp
Gradual stiffening of the joints is common with arthritis

definitions: act of making someone unable to breathe properly or preventing something from happening
examples: The stifling of free speech concerned many citizens worldwide
The stifling of creativity in schools worried many educators

definitions: mark of disgrace or negative attitude associated with a particular circumstance or quality
examples: There's still a stigma attached to mental health issues
The stigma of bankruptcy followed him for many years

definitions: action of treating someone unfairly by publicly disapproving of their characteristics or circumstances
examples: The stigmatization of certain illnesses prevents people from seeking help
Social stigmatization can lead to isolation and depression

definitions: shoe with a very high thin heel
thin dagger with a narrow blade
examples: She wore red stilettos to the formal dinner party
The designer's new stiletto heels were featured in the magazine
The museum displayed an ancient Italian stiletto from the Renaissance
The stiletto was a favored weapon among Renaissance nobility

definitions: birth of a baby who has died in the womb after twenty weeks
examples: The hospital provides counseling services for parents after a stillbirth
Medical research aims to reduce the rate of stillbirth worldwide

definitions: one of two long poles with footrests used for walking high above ground
examples: The circus performer walked gracefully on stilts across the stage
Children practiced walking on stilts at the summer camp

definitions: substance that increases activity in the body, especially nervous system and metabolism
examples: Caffeine is a mild stimulant found in coffee and tea
The doctor prescribed a stimulant to help with attention deficit disorder

definitions: action of making something more active or the state of being made more active
examples: Mental stimulation helps keep the brain healthy as we age
The economic stimulation package aimed to boost consumer spending

definitions: sharp burning pain from an insect bite or contact with something
secret operation by police to catch criminals
examples: The bee sting swelled up and became very painful
She felt the sting of the cold wind on her face
The police sting operation caught several drug dealers last night
The FBI organized a sting to expose the corruption scheme

definitions: sharp organ that some insects and animals use to inject venom
examples: The wasp's stinger got stuck in my arm after it attacked
Bees die after using their stinger because it tears away

definitions: sharp burning feeling or pain caused by something like an insect or plant
examples: The stinging from the jellyfish lasted for several hours
He felt a stinging sensation when the antiseptic touched the wound

definitions: flat diamond-shaped fish with a long tail containing a venomous barb
examples: The stingray glided gracefully along the ocean floor
Swimmers were warned about stingrays hiding in the shallow water

definitions: strong unpleasant smell that makes people want to avoid the source
examples: The stink from the garbage truck filled the entire street
There was a terrible stink coming from the blocked drain

definitions: fixed or limited period of time spent doing a particular activity or job
examples: She did a two-year stint as a teacher in Japan
His stint in the military taught him valuable leadership skills

definitions: regular fixed payment made to support someone during education or training
examples: The research assistant received a monthly stipend from the university
Her stipend barely covered living expenses in the expensive city

definitions: condition or requirement that must be met as part of an agreement
examples: The contract included a stipulation about working hours and overtime
One stipulation of the scholarship was maintaining good grades

definitions: action of mixing something by moving a spoon or similar tool
beginning of a feeling or emotion starting to develop
examples: The stirring of the soup prevented it from burning
Constant stirring ensures the sauce doesn't stick to the pan
She felt the first stirring of hope after hearing the news
There were stirrings of rebellion among the oppressed workers

definitions: metal or leather loop hanging from a saddle to support a rider's foot
examples: She adjusted the stirrups before mounting the horse for her ride
The rider's foot slipped from the stirrup during the jump

definitions: single loop of thread used in sewing or medical sutures
sudden sharp pain in the side caused by strenuous exercise
examples: The doctor put ten stitches in the deep cut
She carefully removed each stitch from the embroidered pattern
He got a stitch in his side while running the marathon
The stitch was so painful she had to stop jogging

definitions: process or result of joining fabric together with thread using needle
examples: The stitching on the leather jacket was done by hand
Quality stitching ensures the garment will last for many years

definitions: defensive barrier or enclosure made of wooden posts driven into the ground
examples: The fort was surrounded by a tall wooden stockade
Prisoners were kept inside the stockade until their trial

definitions: person who buys and sells stocks and other securities on behalf of clients
examples: The stockbroker advised her clients to diversify their investment portfolios
He worked as a stockbroker on Wall Street for twenty years

definitions: employee who fills shelves with merchandise in a store or warehouse
examples: The night stocker worked while the store was closed
She started as a stocker and worked her way up to manager

definitions: person who owns shares of stock in a corporation or company
examples: The stockholders voted on the proposed merger at the annual meeting
As a stockholder, she received quarterly dividend payments

definitions: close-fitting covering for the foot and leg made of nylon or silk
examples: She wore silk stockings with her evening dress
The nurse put on compression stockings to improve circulation

definitions: person who looks after livestock on a farm or ranch
examples: The stockman checked on the cattle every morning at dawn
An experienced stockman can spot sick animals quickly

definitions: large accumulated stock of goods or materials kept for future use
examples: The country maintains a strategic stockpile of oil reserves
They built a stockpile of canned goods for emergencies

definitions: act of gathering and storing large amounts of goods for future use
examples: The stockpiling of weapons violated the international treaty
People began stockpiling food before the predicted storm

definitions: person who can endure pain or hardship without showing feelings or complaining
examples: He remained a stoic throughout his cancer treatment
The stoic rarely showed emotion even in difficult times

definitions: endurance of pain or hardship without complaint or philosophy that teaches self-control
examples: Her stoicism during the crisis inspired everyone around her
Ancient stoicism influenced many modern philosophical movements

definitions: person who tends and feeds fuel to a furnace or fire
examples: The ship's stoker worked in extreme heat below deck
Steam engine stokers shoveled coal throughout their long shifts

definitions: woman's long scarf or shawl worn loosely over the shoulders
examples: She draped a fur stole over her evening gown
The bride wore her grandmother's vintage lace stole

definitions: heavy stamping step made forcefully with the foot
examples: His angry stomp could be heard throughout the house
The dancer's stomp kept rhythm with the drumbeat

definitions: skilled worker who cuts, prepares and builds with stone
examples: The stonemason carefully carved the marble statue
They hired a stonemason to repair the old stone wall

definitions: person who regularly uses marijuana or other recreational drugs
examples: The college stoner spent most weekends getting high with friends
He was known as a stoner in high school

definitions: type of pottery fired at high temperature making it non-porous and durable
examples: The kitchen was filled with handmade stoneware dishes
Stoneware crocks were traditionally used for food storage

definitions: parts of a building or structure made of stone or the craft itself
examples: The cathedral's intricate stonework took decades to complete
They admired the ancient stonework of the castle walls

definitions: form of execution where a group throws stones at a person until death
examples: Stoning was used as capital punishment in ancient times
The practice of stoning still exists in some parts of the world
